collections.name: Great Books of the Western World
collections.description: A series of books that are considered to be among the most important and influential works of literature, philosophy, and science in Western civilization.

collections.name: Harvard Classics
collections.description: A 51-volume anthology of classic works from world literature, compiled and edited by Harvard University president Charles W. Eliot.

collections.name: Penguin Classics
collections.description: A curated collection of classic literature published by Penguin Books, featuring a wide range of authors and genres.

collections.name: Oxford World's Classics
collections.description: A series of classic literature books published by Oxford University Press, known for their scholarly introductions and comprehensive notes.

collections.name: Library of America
collections.description: A nonprofit publisher dedicated to publishing, and keeping in print, authoritative editions of America's best and most significant writing.
